article_title: U.S. Producer Prices Fall 0.4% in April
article_text:
WASHINGTON—A gauge of U.S. business prices fell in April, the latest sign of persistently low inflation across the economy.

The producer-price index for final demand, which measures prices that businesses receive for their goods and services, decreased a seasonally adjusted 0.4% last month from March, the Labor Department said Thursday. Core...

article_metadata.article.origheadline: U.S. Producer Prices Fall 0.4% in April

article_summary:
The producer-price index for final demand, which measures prices that businesses receive for their goods and services, decreased a seasonally adjusted 0.4% last month from March, the Labor Department said Thursday.
WASHINGTON—A gauge of U.S. business prices fell in April, the latest sign of persistently low inflation across the economy.
